New Records: Bam Adebayo recorded a game-high 32 points, 14 rebounds, and multiple assists and defensive contributions in the Heat's win.
The Miami Heat secured their third victory of the season with a 118-98 win over the Washington Wizards.
The Heat set a new record with 21 offensive rebounds and 21 second-chance points in the game.
Key Match Events: Bam Adebayo's offensive dominance, including seven points in the first quarter and 20 in the first half, was a turning point.
The Heat's defensive efforts, including key blocks and steals by Bam Adebayo, contributed to the win.
Miami's dominance on the glass, finishing with 65 total rebounds and 21 offensive rebounds, was a significant factor.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pelle Larsson saw his first real minutes of the season and contributed seven points and two assists.
Kel'el Ware made his NBA debut, playing three minutes at the end of the game.
The Heat's victory marked their first double-digit win of the season.
